mate.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: someone you work with, do an activity with, or share something with
house/flat/room mate (=someone you share a house, room etc with)
mate.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Dad’s office mates are throwing a party for him.
mate.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: I’m going out with my mates tonight.
Most of my school mates are black.
mate.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: used as a friendly way to address a man
mate.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: the sexual partner of an animal
mate.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a husband or wife – used especially in magazines
mate.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: How do women choose their mates?
mate.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: a ship’s officer who is one rank below the captain
mate.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: checkmate in the game of chess
mate.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: if animals mate, they have sex to produce babies
mate.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: It’s quite common for male birds to mate with several females.
mate.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to put animals together so that they will have sex and produce babies
mate.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Rabbits can be mated as early as six months old.
mate.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to achieve the checkmate of your opponent in chess
